intro: Sinningia flammea, commonly known as the flame violet, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces tubular, brightly colored flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Sinningia flammea is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value.
